alert.note: Alert for Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 26 at 3:11PM AKDT until May 26 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ......RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 216 FROM NOON TO 10 PM TODAY... .DISCUSSION... High pressure aloft building over the West Coast and Interior of Alaska through Sat will persist into next week. This will cause a warming trend through the weekend over Interior Alaska, with warm conditions continuing next week. Highs in the 60s and lower 70s will continue over the Interior today and Fri, rising into the 70s over the weekend and remaining warm into next week. The current dry conditions with Min RH of 15-30% will remain through Fri, with a slight increase in moisture over the weekend as evaporating moisture builds up under the subsidence inversion associated with the high aloft. A thermal low pressure trough stretching from Glennallen to Northway to Ft Yukon to Buckland will intensify today, then weaken in place tonight and remain weak through Sat. This is causing west winds 15 mph gusting to 30 mph along the Yukon River this afternoon and evening, with winds decreasing late tonight as the trough weakens. Given the dry fuels and warm, dry conditions, these winds will cause Red Flag conditions in zone 216 through 10 PM today. The winds will decrease late tonight as the temps cool and the thermal trough weakens, and remain less than 15 mph through the weekend. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FOR LOWER KOYUKUK AND MIDDLE YUKON VALLEYS... * AFFECTED AREA...Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys. * TIMING...Noon to 10 PM today. * WINDS...West 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 23 percent. * TEMPERATURES...58 to 73. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires will be possible.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
